lines.text: "No son. Lets walk down and fuck 'em all".
Who are you?
Rocky 6.

[trying to encourage Larry to leave Gang life]
Hey Larry, you could make it out too.
How? Maybe I go to Hollywood. Be Eddie Murphy. Hey Frog, think America is ready to love two niggers at the same time?
I know the routine, Homes. I owe you. You know, that's what makes this country great, hey, Homes?
What's that?
Credit! You got your Visa card. I got you, Homes.
You don't wanna get laid, man. It leads to kissing and pretty soon you gotta talk to 'em.
You ain't got nothing on me!
I got handcuffs on you.
[speaking to a gang member]
It's a cold world blood... No Mercy; ain't that what you write on the walls?
Do you need anything?

[sarcastically]
Jeez. I don't know Hodges. Maybe some of your valuable expertise?
Hey, I doubt that. You guys are doing such a fine job that's why they call us out here at 3 o'clock in the morning.
Hey, why don't you flying CRASH guys go take a flying fuck.
Hey, fuck you.
[scoffs at McGavin]
Fuck you.

[sitting upside down after crashing their car]
My wife wants to meet you. She says, uh, you can bring a date.
Okay...
Hey man, these handcuffs are too tight.
Well they ain't built for comfort, pal.
You wanna look at pussy or learn about this job?
Not yet.
Not yet.

[to the cops about the boy in the tree]
I dunno about this younger generation...

[TV version - after the boy got initiated]
You screwed up now, man... You joined a gang.
Ain't no turning back, homes.
[first lines]
Hey Hodges, what do you think about all those hot shot jitter bugs, huh?
What about 'em?
You never went for this shit, did you?
No way.
Hey you know, if you just cut me half as much slack as you do the rest of those assholes, I might just owe you one.
I have, you do.

[Intimidated and backing down]
Hey, Hodges, Uncle Bob. I don't have any problems with you.

[Angrily]
You got problems with the whole fuckin' world, and I'm in it... and I don't like it!

[to McGavin]
You can try to be a professional! That's the best you can fuckin' do!
Listen, about the other day...
This has nothing to do with the other day.
Shut up! What, I don't get to talk here?
Talk.

I'm sorry about the car. I fucking wiped out, what do you want me to say? Do you want me to say I'm sorry, and it will never happen again? I understand what you're saying. I understand what you're trying to do. But, I didn't sign up for CRASH to play nice to these assholes. You think you get respect? They just laugh, and bump somebody off, and I can't deal with that. And if you can't deal with me, well, I understand that, too.
The police ain't never gonna get anywhere, man. Shaking people down, shining the lights in our eyes, treating all of us like criminals, because of where we live. And right in front of our kids!
Do you want to second guess me?
No, I want to go and bust... him.
So what do you want to do, pull a fire extinguisher out of his ass?
Well, I'll plant one there if I have to, and then you can pull it out, so you don't have to be dicking around in the car all the time!
